title: Problem-Based Geometric Construction and Reasoning Competency Enhancement Course

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic geometric concepts (points, lines, planes, angles, etc.) and experience in constructing geometric figures at the elementary level
context.additional_context: Asynchronous learning environment in smartphone-based limited-technology settings. Emphasizes real-life applications aligned with professional job relevance

learning_goals: Learners can perform constructions of congruent line segments, perpendicular/parallel lines, and angle bisectors in a Dynamic Geometry Environment (DGE) with 80% accuracy
Learners can deliver two or more oral presentations logically explaining invariants (e.g., circle properties) discovered during geometric constructions
Learners can verify three or more geometric propositions inferred using drag functionality and propose improvements through peer evaluation
Learners achieve 70% or higher on assessment tools measuring geometric thinking abilities at Van Hiele Theory Level 3 (relational understanding)
In Problem-Based Learning (PBL) tasks, learners can solve more than 10 construction problems over four weeks through collaborative reasoning with peers

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
